author.name: Bryan Berry - Nathen Harvey - Matt Ray

entry.title: The Business Value of Developer Relations
entry.content:
Listen to our conversation with Mary Thengvall (@mary_grace) about her book: The Business Value of Developer Relations.

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Picks
  • Download
    • Video
    • Audio

Panel

  • Mary Thengvall twitter blog github persea-consulting.com
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, blog
  • Nell Shamrell-Harrington github, twitter, blog

Outline

  • Mary's book: The Business Value of Developer Relations
  • What is developer relations? (i.e.: DevRel)
    • Building relations with the developer community
    • Using the term "developer" as a generic term
  • How does this defer from "community development" as we know it?
    • Developer Evangelism
    • Community Management/Building
    • Project Manager
    • Events Coordinator
  • Is DevRel the new DevOps?
    • Bridging vs. Bonding
  • How is DevRel a bridge to sales and marketing?
  • How the book came about
  • Why the avocados?!
  • Developer advocacy vs being a traditional developer
  • Why technical communities are the keys to success
  • Getting started in DevRel
    • DevRel Weekly Newsletter
    • DevRel Collective -- for folks who are actively doing DevRel in their professional work; also contains resources for the DevRel-curious.

Picks

Nell

  • Quiver
  • Gone Home

Mary

  • The ONE Thing
  • The Good Place

Nathen

  • Broken Record with Malcolm Gladwell and Rick Rubin
  • Barr Estate Winery: 2013 DANE HEAD
